thread.title: CU volleyball: Buffs break streak against No. 6 Stanford
thread.title_full: CU volleyball: Buffs break streak against No. 6 Stanford

author:
Pat Rooney 

BuffZone.com Writer
title: CU volleyball: Buffs break streak against No. 6 Stanford
text:
CU volleyball: Buffs break streak against No. 6 Stanford Winless mark against Cardinal no more after four-set win By Pat Rooney 
BuffZone.com Writer Posted: 10/18/2015 06:58:44 PM MDT Colorado's Naghede Abu, right, pushes a shot over Stanford's Sydney Brown during Sunday's game in Boulder. The Buffaloes won 3-1. More photos: BuffZone.com ( Cliff Grassmick / Staff Photographer ) 
As seniors, Alexis Austin and Nicole Edelman have experienced their fair share of heartbreak at the hands of the Stanford Cardinal. 
Now the University of Colorado duo can always say they were part of the team that finally ended the Buffaloes' prolonged drought against one of the top volleyball programs in the nation. 
CU dictated the action throughout much of Sunday afternoon's contest at the Coors Events Center, outlasting No. 6-ranked Stanford in a wild finish in set 2 before posting a four-set victory in a Pac-12 Conference showdown. 
The Buffs had been 0-14 all-time against the Cardinal, including an 0-7 mark since CU joined the Pac-12. It was CU's third win against a ranked opponent this season, a ledger that includes an early home win against then-No. 9 Florida State and a road win two weeks ago against then-No. 22 Oregon. 
"It's a great feeling, to be honest," Austin said. "We've been trying to beat them for four years now, so to finally get that win is great. Now we have to carry it on to all the other games." 
CU received consecutive kills from Joslyn Hayes and Gabby Simpson to break a 23-23 tie late in set 1 and take an early advantage. The Buffs took command of the match late in set 2, breaking a 25-25 tie with consecutive points from Hayes and Nicole Edelman to take a 2-0 set lead into the break. 
Stanford avoided the sweep with a 25-23 decision in set 3, but the Buffs refused to wither and steadily pulled away throughout the second half of the fourth set. Advertisement 
"I remember freshman year getting swept in three (by Stanford) pretty easily," Edelman said. "I think it shows all the dedication and hard work that we've put in. Alexis and I have been playing against most of those starters for a long time. They're all great players, but it definitely feels good to get that win." 
After pushing No. 1 USC to five sets at home last weekend but then following that effort by getting swept by UCLA, the Buffs responded admirably over a weekend that also included a Friday night victory against Cal. The Buffs improved to 12-8 overall and, more importantly, 4-4 in what is arguably the toughest volleyball conference in the nation. 
"I look at the last four matches, and I know (UCLA) didn't go the way that we wanted, but there's really good volleyball being played," CU coach Liz Kritza said. "People that know the game a little more understand that some of the things these young women are doing are truly exceptional." 
Gabby Simpson paced the CU attack with a career-high 25 kills while Austin added 17. Edelman's 50 assists marked the fourth time in six games she has reached the 50-assist mark, and Cierra Simpson's 16 digs led a solid team-wide defensive effort that saw four CU players record at least 10. 
"I think we were more aware of what we needed to take care of and making sure we didn't have lulls in our play," Edelman said. 
Pat Rooney: rooneyp@dailycamera.com or twitter.com/prooney07 
Colorado 3, Stanford 1 Stanford (11-5, 5-3) 23 25 25 21 CU (12-8, 4-4) 25 27 23 25 
Kills — Stanford : Hodson 22, Lutz 15, Howard 13; CU : G. Simpson 25, Austin 17. 
Blocks — Stanford : Vanjak 7, Burgess 6, Hodson 5; CU : Abu 7, Austin 6. 
Assists — Stanford : Bugg 53; CU : Edelman 50. 
Aces — Stanford : Hodson 1, Humphreys 1; CU : C. Simpson 1, Austin 1. 
Digs — Stanford : McKenna 16, Hodson 8; CU : C. Simpson 16, Austin 12, D'Agosta 10, G. Simpson 10.
